title: Cape Cod National Seashore: Directions & Transportation
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Directions & Transportation             Directions         Entry sign on Route 6 in Eastham near Salt Pond Visitor Center   By Car: From Boston area: Take Route 3 south, to the Sagamore Bridge in Bourne. Follow Route 6 eastward to Eastham and Provincetown. From Providence, RI: Take I-95 north to, I-195. Follow Route 6 eastward as described above. Once on Cape, most park features are off Route 6 from Eastham to Provincetown. Stop at a park visitor center, or at a chamber of commerce, to get a map of the local vicinity. For a web based map of Cape Cod National Seashore, and surrounding areas, visit the park maps page. Salt Pond Visitor Center, open year round                                   50 Nauset Road                                               Eastham, MA 02642 508-255-3421  Province Lands Visitor Center, open seasonally 171 Race Point Road Provincetown, MA 02657     508-487-1256    Please observe the state's 5-minute idling limit and help Cape Cod National Seashore be a Climate Friendly Park! Alternative Transportation: Visit these pages for more information on available Getting Around the Cape and Bicycling options.
